Text Fields built according to MUI specification


Supported properties (with variantsğŸ‰):

  • State: inactive, hover, focus
  • With/without value
  • Start Adornments ( icon, text)
  • End Adornments (con, text)
  • Size
  • Help Text
  • Error
  • Required
  • Disabled

You can mix properties in any valid* combination.


Styling

Styling that are easy to implement:

  • Color styles (text, borders)
  • Text font (I do not recommend to change the text line-height, size and font-weight, this probably won't affect the production component)
  • Input border radius


Roadmap

  • Add proper documentation and examples
  • Add multiline component
  • Add autocomplete component with multiple values support
  • Add search field property
  • When auto-layout is released, update component according to new functionality**

What's missing and won't be implemented in the foreseeable future:

  • 'Standard' or 'filled' input styles â€” feel free to remix this file for themğŸ¤
  • Password property (you can use end adornment for it)
  • Number property
  • Different ways to use icons


Limitations and differences from MUI

  • Something that might look like limitation but in fact it is not: the component is not going to resize itself based on text input. This is exactly the way it works in the React component, i.e. component width is either fixed or defined by parent, and in case the input content is larger than the container, it's overflow will be hidden (you can scroll left-right in Figma prototype). For auto-resizable height, you'll need the multiline component (coming later already here!).
